<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 123, 761, 140]]<|/det|>
2 The position vectors of points \(A, B, C\), relative to the origin \(O\), are \(\mathbf{a}, \mathbf{b}, \mathbf{c}\), where

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[273, 146, 722, 169]]<|/det|>
\[
\mathbf{a}=3 \mathbf{i}+2 \mathbf{j}-\mathbf{k}, \quad \mathbf{b}=4 \mathbf{i}-3 \mathbf{j}+2 \mathbf{k}, \quad \mathbf{c}=3 \mathbf{i}-\mathbf{j}-\mathbf{k}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 175, 533, 192]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 207, 435, 241]]<|/det|>
Hence find the volume of the tetrahedron \(O A B C\), given that the volume of a tetrahedron is \(\frac{1}{3} \times\) area of base \(\times\) perpendicular height.

\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 166, 612, 198]]<|/det|>

8

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 227, 487, 274]]<|/det|>
8 The vector \(\mathbf{e}\) is an eigenvector of the matrix \(\mathbf{A}\), with corresponding eigenvalue \(\lambda\), and is also an eigenvector of the matrix \(\mathbf{B}\), with corresponding eigenvalue \(\mu\). Show that \(\mathbf{e}\) is an eigenvector of the matrix \(\mathbf{A B}\) with corresponding eigenvalue \(\lambda \mu\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 289, 474, 305]]<|/det|>

-1 & -1 & 3 \\
0 & 1 & 2 \\
0 & 0 & 2
\end{array}\right),
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 371, 414, 387]]<|/det|>
and find corresponding eigenvectors.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 401, 576, 446]]<|/det|>

1 & -1 & 1 \\
-6 & -3 & 4 \\
-9 & -3 & 7
\end{array}\right),
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 503, 435, 520]]<|/det|>
and state the corresponding eigenvalue.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 534, 789, 551]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 749, 642, 766]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 780, 745, 797]]<|/det|>
